page.title: 14THE ELDERLY
page.content: Thornhill's population includes 10% over the age of 70.This is made up of people who have always lived locally and of others who have decided to retire here because of the pleasant rural surroundings;the reasonable services and ease of getting to other larger towns. Most of the incoming retired people have bought bungalows in one of the 4 new, private housing developments. Many of the retired locals still stay in their own properties whilst others are looked after by their children or, find shelter in one of the two old peoples' homes in Thornhill. In May 1985 a sheltered housing scheme was opened on the outskirts of Thornhill with 26 self-contained, one storeyed houses and a warden's house.
